oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Pet Milk - #131 - 1958-09-26 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pet Milk sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 26, 1958. Featuring T. Tommy Cutrer (host/performer), Flatt & Scruggs (performers), Foggy Mountain Boys (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Jordanaires (performers), Marvin Hughes (performer), and Tommy Warren (performer). Listed as episode #131, broadcast on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Flatt & Scruggs; Rod Brasfield; Foggy Mountain Boys; Jordanaires; T. Tommy Cutrer; Marvin Hughes; Tommy Warren
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Test tones -- (01:30) Opening statement (T. Tommy Cutrer) -- Pet Milk commercial (T. Tommy Cutrer, Jordanaires) -- (02:10) Opening theme -- (02:20) T. Tommy Cutrer introduces the cast -- (02:42) Why Did You Wonder (Flatt & Scruggs) -- (04:45) Lester Flatt thanks and talks with Cutrer and introduces the Jordanaires -- (06:10) Oh, Lonesome Me (Jordanaires) -- (08:15) Pet Milk commercial (T. Tommy Cutrer, Jordanaires) -- (09:30) The Bear Creek Hop (Tommy Warren fiddle) -- (10:18) Lester Flatt introduces Rod Brasfield -- (10:37) Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield) -- (14:37) T. Tommy Cutrer introduces the next tune -- (14:57) The Big Black Train (Flatt & Scruggs) -- (17:15) Pet Milk commercial (T. Tommy Cutrer, Jordanaires) -- (19:24) Flatt introduces the next tune -- (19:45) Earl's Breakdown (Foggy Mountain Boys) -- (21:11) Flatt, Cutrer introduces the Jordanaires -- (22:00) Ezekiel Saw The Wheel (Jordanaires) -- (23:35) Cutrer, Flatt, and Brasfield talk and introduces the next tune -- (24:15) Alabama Jubilee (T. Tommy Cutrer, Rod Brasfield, Foggy Mountain Boys) -- (25:50) Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, T. Tommy Cutrer) -- (27:45) Pet Milk commercial (T. Tommy Cutrer) -- (28:49) Cutrer introduces Flatt & Scruggs -- (28:58) I Don't Care (Flatt & Scruggs) -- (30:46) Closing theme and statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand Ole Opry (Radio program); Pet Milk Company; Cutrer, T. Tommy; Flatt and Scruggs and the Foggy Mountain Boys (Musical group); Flatt, Lester; Foggy Mountain Boys; Scruggs, Earl; Hughes, Marvin; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Warren, Tommy;
